sentences.english: Detong, add C1883 to Lian Yi book.
sentences.chinese: 茶桶，將C1883增入《浴塘漣漪》書中。

sentences.english: Ripples undulating, that's damp thanksgiving of Ba River.
sentences.chinese: 漣漪泳動，那是巴河溼漉漉的感恩。

sentences.english: Throw a stone into still water and watch the ripples spread in rings .
sentences.chinese: 投一塊石頭到靜止的水裏，看漣漪盪漾成圈。

sentences.english: The news, such as stone into the water, and immediately sparked countless ripples.
sentences.chinese: 這一消息如石入水，立即激起無數漣漪。

sentences.english: Happiness is like a pebble dropped into a pool to set in motion an ever-widening circle of  ripples.
sentences.chinese: 快樂就像一塊爲了激起陣陣漣漪而丟進池塘的小石頭。

sentences.english: Lamp shadow dispersed with water in the lake forming a circle of light ripples.
sentences.chinese: 燈影隨着水波向湖中散去，形成一圈圈光的漣漪。

sentences.english: I love to paint the light reflected off water when it ripples.
sentences.chinese: 我愛畫水面漾起漣漪時反射出的粼粼波光。

sentences.english: This wind is disrupted by the black hole, causing turbulence and ripples beyond the disk.
sentences.chinese: 風遭到黑洞的干擾之後，形成了盤外沿的紊流和漣漪。

sentences.english: The lake dimpled at the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 微風使水面上蕩起了漣漪。

sentences.english: Give thanks to God so that you may extend this love ever outward in a widening circle of gladness.
sentences.chinese: 向主獻上你的感恩而將這份愛像快樂的漣漪向外擴展。

sentences.english: It ripples out，moreover，to the heartstrings that will tug， And always leaves an echo that is very like a hug.
sentences.chinese: 它的漣漪深深波及心絃，總會留下反響，宛若擁抱。

sentences.english: Tolerance simply has a rippling effect that makes people happier.
sentences.chinese: 寬容很容易帶來的漣漪效應讓人們感覺更快樂。

sentences.english: This feeling ripples in my heart lake, diffusion, bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 這種感覺漣漪般的，在我的心湖擴散，點點滴滴。

sentences.english: A gentle breeze rippled the surface of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 一陣微風吹過，湖面上漾起圈圈漣漪。

sentences.english: What will the global ripples look like?
sentences.chinese: 這又會在全球引起怎樣的漣漪呢？

sentences.english: I heard that you who who how how how, mood swings the circle of ripples.
sentences.chinese: 聽說你們中誰誰怎樣怎樣了，心情就盪開大圈的漣漪。

definition: billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
